bibl.title: Alfred Woods v. John H. McGraw. Testimony
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington

body.p: IN RE A THE APPLICATION OF ALFRED WOODS FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS
TERRITORY OF WASHINGTON COUNTY OF KING SS

ALFRED WOODS BEING FIRST DULY SWORN DEPOSES AND SAYS: THAT HE IS THE APPLICANT IN THE ABOVE ENTITLED CAUSE, THAT SHORTLY AFTER HIS CONFINEMENT IN MC NEAL'S ISLAND ABOUT SIX WEEKS AGO HE WAS TAKEN SICH AND EVER SINCE HAS BEEN AND IS NOW IN POOR HEALTH.

THAT HE IS ADVISED BY J.S.M. SMART , A PHYSCIAR WHO MADE AN EXAMINATION OF HIM THAT HE IS SUFFERING FROM HEART DISEASE. THAT ABOUT TWO WEEKS AGO, WHILE CONFINED IN THE COUNTY JAIL OF KING COUNTY, HE CONTRACTED A VERY SEVERE COLD WHICH SETTLED ON HIS LUNGS AND FROM WHICH HE EVER SINCE HAS BEEN SUFFERING, THAT HE HAS BEEN TAKING MEDICINCE PRESCRIBED BY THE PHYSICIAN ATTENDING THE COUNTY JAIL BUT THAT HE SEEMS TO GET NO RELIEF THEREFROM. THAT HE DOES NOT BELIEVES THAT UNLESS E CAN BE RELIEVED FROM SAID COUNTY JAIL HE WILL NOT GET WELL.
SUBSCRIBED AND SWORN TO BEFORE ME THIS 27th DAY OF OCTOBER 1885.
In the District Court, Third Judicial District, holding Terms at Seattle
In re application for writ of Habeas Corpus Alfred Woods
FILED OCT 28 1885 James Seavey, Clerk. By James Ludlow, Deputy.
